newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers firm on strong regional markets.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers firm on strong regional markets.

text.p: Singapore bunker indications on Monday were quoted firmer from Friday tracking strong crude oil and European bunker prices, traders said.

Majors were quoting 180-cst at $128-$129 per tonne, with independents at $125-$126. Independents were indicating 380-cst supplies at $121-$122 and majors at $124-$125. Prices were about a dollar firmer from Friday.

"Demand has not increased very much," a trader said. "But prices are rising on back of firm crudes and firm bunker prices in the region," he said. MDO prices were stable at $223-228 and gas oil at $235-$238. -- Singapore newsroom (+65-870-3082)
